poem:
Title: Parliament on the Pitch

Boris, bold and buoyant, basked atop a sea of need,
In Durham's county cradle, where cricket clubs breed.
The Northern Echo's headline like a piercing winter's tees,
A cascade of hallowed promises, borne aloft by the breeze.
Yet as the rooster crowed, the excitement began to fray,
Upon Stockton-on-Tees, dawn greeted yet another day.
